body_html:
@hagerrady13 you likely have nans in your model as number of epochs grow. A quick sanity check would be to run with the anomaly detector in pytorch 0.4.1. Arithmetic operations on CPU when nans are involved are much slower.

Here's a link to the anomaly detector in v0.4.1: https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/autograd.html#torch.autograd.detect_anomaly

body:
@hagerrady13 you likely have nans in your model as number of epochs grow. A quick sanity check would be to run with the anomaly detector in pytorch 0.4.1. Arithmetic operations on CPU when nans are involved are much slower.

Here's a link to the anomaly detector in v0.4.1: https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/autograd.html#torch.autograd.detect_anomaly
